data.title: Couple Name Generator
data.solution:
# Couple name generator (vowels = AEIOU; split after first non-opening vowel)
name_1 = gets.chomp
name_2 = gets.chomp
a, b = name_1.split(/(?<=(?<!^)[aeiou])/i,2)
c, d = name_2.split(/(?<=(?<!^)[aeiou])/i,2)
couple_name_1 = a + (d||"")
couple_name_2 = c + (b||"")
puts [couple_name_1, couple_name_2].sort * " or "
data.statement:
Take a pair of input names and produce a pair of potential couple names for this couple.

A couple name is formed by splitting each person's name into two parts and then joining the parts together from each other's names.

{{Ben}} + {{Jennifer}} → {{Bennifer or Jen}}

The rule for where to split the names isn't well defined but here we use the following rule:

Split the names into two halves with the <<split after the first vowel that isn't at the start of the name>> (first non-leading vowel). Vowels are AEIOU.

For the name {{Elliot}} that becomes {{Elli}} & {{ot}}, while {{Fiona}} becomes {{Fi}} & {{ona}}. So their possible couple names are {{Elliona or Fiot}}.

Print the two possible couple names for the input couple in alphabetical order in the format "{{Name1 or Name2}}".

<<Note :>> For names that have no non-leading vowels upon which to split, the 'second half' is simply an empty string. E.g. {{"Ang"}} → {{"Ang"}} & {{""}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read name1:string(20)
read name2:string(20)
write couple_name_1 or couple_name_2

OUTPUT
Alphabetical order

STATEMENT
Couple name generator (vowels = AEIOU; split after first non-opening vowel)
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> [[name_1]]; the first name of one member of the couple
<<Line 2 :>> [[name_2]]; the first name of the other member of the couple
data.outputDescription: <<1 Line :>> The two possible couple names in alphabetical order, separated by {{" or "}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Take a pair of input names and produce a pair of potential couple names for this couple.

A couple name is formed by splitting each person's name into two parts and then joining the parts together from each other's names.

Ben + Jennifer → Bennifer or Jen

The rule for where to split the names isn't well defined but here we use the following rule:

Split the names into two halves with the split after the first vowel that isn't at the start of the name (first non-leading vowel). Vowels are AEIOU.

For the name Elliot that becomes Elli & ot, while Fiona becomes Fi & ona. So their possible couple names are Elliona or Fiot.

Print the two possible couple names for the input couple in alphabetical order in the format "Name1 or Name2".

Note : For names that have no non-leading vowels upon which to split, the 'second half' is simply an empty string. E.g. "Ang" → "Ang" & "".
Input
Line 1 : name_1; the first name of one member of the couple
Line 2 : name_2; the first name of the other member of the couple
Output
1 Line : The two possible couple names in alphabetical order, separated by " or ".
Constraints
Example
Input
Ben
Jennifer
Output
Bennifer or Jen
